thread.title: Four road trips from Las Vegas to see the Nevada desert
thread.title_full: Four road trips from Las Vegas to see the Nevada desert | Travel | Travel News and Holiday Deals | | The Advertiser

author: Scott Podmore
title: Four road trips from Las Vegas to see the Nevada desert
text:
NO OTHER destination rewards spontaneity like Sin City. Famous for its short-term delights, there I was in hot Las Vegas, exhausted and laden with luggage after a long flight, and then … there she was.
Dressed in red, she had curves in all the right places. Las Vegas had delivered on its promise of a beautiful escort to help me explore the bright lights and beyond. Picking up my hot- red convertible Volkswagen from Advantage Car Rentals was a seamless experience after a long flight from Australia and this gorgeous car had me wanting to hit the road immediately, to break the lure of the glitzy Strip and seek out Mother Nature’s finest spectacles in southern Nevada.
My mission was daily road trips up to an hour away before retreating to the luxuries of the famous Strip for world-class food and entertainment at night.
Way to relax ... the penthouse master room at the Delano in Las Vegas. Picture: Supplied Source: Supplied
First stop was a 15-minute drive from the airport to my base camp for the week, the stylish Delano hotel at the Mandalay Bay complex. The all-suite boutique hotel’s floor-to-ceiling windows offer endless views of the city and with a location at the southern end of the Strip, Delano serves as an ideal place from which to explore the best of both worlds.
Soon after a quick freshen up I was out the door like a rattle snake slithering through the Mojave sands. In the lift I greeted a bling-ed up and mannequin-esque Pamela Anderson with a courteous nod (though it may well have been a mannequin) and jumped in the VDub. That was the daily routine for the days ahead. Try these day trips for size.
Road tripping ... to the Red Rock Canyon. Picture: Scott Podmore Source: Supplied
Escape No.1
Red Rock Canyon
(25 minutes)
Conditions are hot and dry in summer so load up on bottles of water provided free at Delano’s valet. The fast pace of the Strip quickly subsides once out on the highway as scenery smacks you in the senses. Copper-coloured mountains leap out from the desert floor highlighted by Red Rock Canyon’s bluffs, cliffs and petrified sandstone boulders.
Time really does stand still out here. These mountains were formed by geological forces including fractured faults where the earth’s crust collided over millions of years and fossilised sand dunes. Some cliffs reach a kilometre high. It really is breathtaking. The 20km round-trip tourist route at the actual site is a must-do.
The return: Tom Colicchio’s Heritage Steak at The Mirage
Chef Tom’s game plan is about meats prepared entirely over an open flame from charcoal grills to wood-burners. A smooth-talking and well presented floor team raises the bar and the food is killer melt-in-the mouth Wagyu beef, scallops the size of baseballs and pork belly so tender you could cry. There’s heart in the mission, too: Colicchio only chooses antibiotic-free meat from farmers committed to time-honoured farming practices and heritage breeds. Big tick.
More: mirage.com/restaurants
Spectacular ... houseboats can be rented on man-made Lake Mead. Picture: Scott Podmore Source: Supplied
Escape No.2
Lake Mead and Callville Bay Resort & Marina
(45 minutes)
Monster-sized man-made Lake Mead is a major recreation area in addition to being a major water artery for the region, originally formed by the building of Hoover Dam on the Colorado River in 1935. Callville Bay Resort and Marina hums with houseboats, jet skis, and speed boats. The big drawcard is the ultimate houseboat adventures on offer providing a visual feast of desert/water contrasts, mountains and canyons. All Forever Houseboat rentals include a waterside, barbecue, kitchen and a top
deck with canopy; deluxe widescreen TVs and stainless steel kitchens. Wildlife comes out to play up around the banks and I was lucky to get close to a coyote, eagles, mallards, grebes and hummingbirds. If you’re lucky, a bighorn sheep may wander down for a drink.
More: callvillebay.com/rentals/Forever
The return: Lago at Bellagio
So much to choose from ... the Lago at the Bellagio in Las Vegas. Picture: Supplied Source: Supplied
The new Lago by Julian Serrano at Bellagio sparkles with opulence. The journey to reach the restaurant alone is dreamy as you pass Bellagio’s Conservatory & Botanical Gardens summer display with vibrant ocean scenes and gazillions of fresh florals.
The exhibit combines iconic underwater and beach elements including mermaids, sunken ships and sandcastles, cascading water walls and more.
Turning the tables on traditional big family serves, Lago’s Italian small plates take the spotlight as Spanish super chef Serrano dishes up daring and more-ish interpretations of Italian, each stacked with knockout flavours. Tip: Get a seat on the outdoor patio to absorb surreal views of the Fountains of Bellagio.
More: bellagio.com/restaurants
Massive area ... The famous Hoover Dam. Picture: iStock Source: Supplied
Escape No.3
Hoover Dam
Let’s see, we’re back in 1929 in a harsh climate, remote location and facing solid rock. So why not build a massive arch-gravity dam? Something with 2.4 million cubic metres of concrete, spillways, the lot? Crazy but brilliant, and also serving the dual purpose of being a film set for great flicks such as Transformers and more recently San Andreas . The sheer size of this man-made but essential engineering masterpiece really is hard to put into words, so taking a guided tour of the powerplant and passageways within Hoover Dam itself is highly recommended to gain an understanding of the purpose this mighty Nevada icon serves.
More : Hoover Dam
The return: Boulder Brewing Co
The must stop-off point in the small township of Boulder is where the craft beers are cold and tasty and the atmosphere warm and addictive.
Practically a museum in itself, Boulder Dam Brewing Co is a few minutes down the road on the return to Vegas. Mementos such as axes, picks and gauges used in the construction of the dam adorn the inside walls and in the beer garden.
Owner Lisa Combs says the brewpub is Boulder City’s hot spot for music which can be “anything from bluegrass to rock ’n’ roll and old-fashioned country”. Get stuck into the food menu, too, which is a mix of naughty but nice treats including battered pickles and cheese-loaded pretzels, burgers, salads and pub fare.
The beers, of course, are the focal point. Boulder Dam Brewing Co brews everything from European pilsners to happy pale ales to rich, creamy stouts.
Amazing rock formations ... the Valley of Fire State Park. Picture: iStock Source: Supplied
Escape No.4
Valley of Fire
(60 minutes)
Seek out Pink Jeep tours, an institution in Vegas, for a small group tour through the mesmerising Valley Of Fire, Nevada’s oldest state park, with entertaining and informed commentary along the way. The park earnt its name from its fiery red sandstone, formed from fossilised sand dunes more than 150 million years ago by a shift in the Earth’s crust, faulting and wind and water erosion.
Today, only wild animals dwell within Valley of Fire year-round. Rattlesnakes, kangaroo rats, kit foxes, coyotes, bighorn sheep and the white-tailed antelope ground squirrels are just a few. Oh, and cougars, of course, “but only at night”, as my highly entertaining guide Mike Franklin pointed out, “as opposed to the Strip – these particular cougars are hard to spot given they’re minus the bright red lipstick and high heels.”
See the sunrise ... in the Valley of Fire. Picture: iStock Source: Supplied
More: pinkjeeptours.com
The return: Order in at Delano
A long hot day in the sun exploring the Valley of Fire couldn’t end any better way than a long soak in your double spa and ordering in at Delano.
Of course, for those daring enough, try your luck in the adjoining casino at Mandalay Bay and, who knows, you just may find a way to cover the whole Vegas experience … or make it more expensive.
More: delanolasvegas.com
Go2
LAS VEGAS
GETTING THERE
Flight Centre has return airfares to Las Vegas from about $1100 with Delta/Virgin Australia. See flightcentre.com.au
GETTING AROUND
Advantage Rent A Car is offering Escape readers a 10 per cent discount code for all car hire throughout the United States and does not have any blackouts. See advantage.com and use CD03BFEEB9 in the promo or corporate code box or visit advantage.com/? rc=CD03BFEEB9
STAYING THERE
Delano Las Vegas is a luxury resort within the 43-storey golden tower at Mandalay Bay Resort Complex. See delanolasvegas.com
